channel.title: How to Port forward Sky/Virgin/NetGear
channel.description:
[center][IMG]http://i895.photobucket.com/albums/ac160/alexman122/MessyScapeLogo-1.jpg[/img][/center] [center]Messyscape Tuts! noobs - 4/10 Experts - 9.5 Hey Guys. I'm here to give out Decent tuts that should be easy for you to follow :)[/center]
First of all go press your start and search CMD.. Should look like this.. [img]http://i895.photobucket.com/albums/ac160/alexman122/cmd.png[/img]
Then type in "Ipconfig" then enter.. Once done. You should see list of stuff... you need to concentrate on " IPv4 Address" and "Default Address" Picture Bellow [IMG]http://i895.photobucket.com/albums/ac160/alexman122/cmd2a.png[/img]
Okay.. now for some fun! for all routers type in your Default Address on your "internet Explore" Some might work on google chrome But not all routers.. Mine is 192.168.0.1 so i put that in then enter.. So copy bellow [IMG]http://i895.photobucket.com/albums/ac160/alexman122/router.png[/img]
As you see.. i have Sky Broadband.. So might be harder explain for netgear.. So if you got netgear/virgin.. Read bottom So press "Security" Then It should ask for your Username And Password
ALL ROUTERS POSSIBLE USERS AND PASSES Skys router Username - Pass Admin - Password (100%) Sky - Password Admin - Sky
Virgin router Virgin - Password (100%)
Others can be given on your router.. Just have to look or ask your parents As they might changed the password.
So when you found ur user and pass.. Press Services > Add Custom Service
After that.. write this Name: "Name of your server" Type: TCP/UCP Start port: 43594 End Port: 43594 Example bellow [IMG]http://i895.photobucket.com/albums/ac160/alexman122/example.png[/img]
Then press "Apply"
When your done.. Press "Firewall Rules" You should see "Outbound Services" And "Inbound Services"
Add Outbound Services.. - Service - There should be your added service there Action - ALLOW always LAN Users - Any Then press Apply .. Example bellow [IMG]http://i895.photobucket.com/albums/ac160/alexman122/1.png[/img]
Add Inbound Services.. - service - The one you added Action - ALLOW always Send to LAN Server: 192 _ 168 _ 0 _ 2 (look on ur cmd "IPv4 Address") wan users - Any Then Apply! Examples bellow [IMG]http://i895.photobucket.com/albums/ac160/alexman122/2.png[/img]
Now People can access the 43594 port.. now sort out the ip..
Simple.. go to.. [url=http://www.no-ip.com/]http://www.no-ip.com/[/url]. Register acc.. Then log in.. From there.. Add Host.. [url=https://www.no-ip.com/members/dns/host.php]https://www.no-ip.com/members/dns/host.php[/url]
Hostname: "your server" (then choose what domain of the ip) The just hit create host..
Next is to download DUC [url=https://www.no-ip.com/downloads.php]https://www.no-ip.com/downloads.php[/url] Use this to make sure your Server ip Is working..
I hope it works for you sky people :D!
VIRGIN ROUTER once you log in from your 192.168.0.1 you should see settings of port forwarding. Press that.. You should see the following format.
Name: "Name of server" Sever: 192.168.0.2 (on cmd) Then that should be it.. do following no-ip..
Hope it helps!
Credits 100% explained by me... Owner Alex ;)

item.title: How to Port forward Sky/Virgin/NetGear
item.dc:creator: @messyscape messyscape
item.description:
@messyscape wrote:

[center][/center]
[center]Messyscape Tuts!
noobs - 4/10
Experts - 9.5
Hey Guys. I’m here to give out Decent tuts that should be easy for you to follow :)[/center]

First of all go press your start and search CMD… Should look like this…

Then type in “Ipconfig” then enter… Once done. You should see list of stuff…
you need to concentrate on " IPv4 Address" and “Default Address”
Picture Bellow

Okay… now for some fun!
for all routers type in your Default Address on your “internet Explore” Some might work on google chrome But not all routers… Mine is 192.168.0.1 so i put that in then enter…
So copy bellow

As you see… i have Sky Broadband… So might be harder explain for netgear… So if you got netgear/virgin… Read bottom
So press “Security” Then It should ask for your Username And Password

ALL ROUTERS POSSIBLE USERS AND PASSES
Skys router
Username - Pass
Admin - Password (100%)
Sky - Password
Admin - Sky

Virgin router
Virgin - Password (100%)

Others can be given on your router… Just have to look or ask your parents As they might changed the password.

So when you found ur user and pass… Press
Services > Add Custom Service

After that…
write this
Name: “Name of your server”
Type: TCP/UCP
Start port: 43594
End Port: 43594
Example bellow

Then press “Apply”

When your done… Press “Firewall Rules”
You should see “Outbound Services” And “Inbound Services”

Add Outbound Services… -
Service - There should be your added service there
Action - ALLOW always
LAN Users - Any
Then press Apply … Example bellow

Add Inbound Services… -
service - The one you added
Action - ALLOW always
Send to LAN Server: 192 _ 168 _ 0 _ 2 (look on ur cmd “IPv4 Address”)
wan users - Any
Then Apply!
Examples bellow

Now People can access the 43594 port…
now sort out the ip…

Simple… go to… http://www.no-ip.com/.
Register acc… Then log in…
From there… Add Host… https://www.no-ip.com/members/dns/host.php

Hostname: “your server” (then choose what domain of the ip)
The just hit create host…

Next is to download DUC
https://www.no-ip.com/downloads.php
Use this to make sure your Server ip Is working…

I hope it works for you sky people :D!

VIRGIN ROUTER
once you log in from your 192.168.0.1
you should see settings of port forwarding.
Press that…
You should see the following format.

Name: “Name of server”
Sever: 192.168.0.2 (on cmd)
Then that should be it… do following no-ip…

Hope it helps!

Credits 100% explained by me… Owner Alex

Read full topic
